thread.title: Prep roundup

title: Prep roundup
text:
Prep roundup 
FULTON, Ill. — Fulton’s playoff hopes ended Friday with a 48-28 loss to Rockridge in Three Rivers Conference football on homecoming night. 
Fulton had an early 14-8 lead in the first quarter thanks to two touchdown passes from quarterback Tyler Sweenie. The first one was for 16 yards to homecoming king Jack Lemke, while the second one went to fellow senior Devon Ballard for 4 yards. 
Rockridge replied with two scores of its own. Sophomore quarterback Michael Griffin threw two touchdown passes — for 11 and 48 yards — to put the Rockets up 16-14. 
The Rockets posted 16 more points to pull away from the Steamers in the fourth quarter. Fulton did score twice in the second half, including a Michael Pidde 2-yard touchdown run and a Rodney Gossard 7-yard touchdown run. 
Morrison rallies 
AMBOY, Ill. — Even though Amboy took the opening kickoff back for a touchdown on Friday, Morrison did not let that deter its hopes. 
Morrison rallied from a 26-8 halftime deficit to come back to win 40-33 on the road. 
Morrison took the lead on a 57-yard touchdown pass with 5:54 left, then Andy Bird iced it away with an 8-yard scoring run with 1:45 to play. 
Tigers top E/P 
PRINCETON, Ill. — Princeton ran its record to 8-0 and put a dent in Erie/Prophetstown’s playoff hopes with a 39-22 victory in Three Rivers Conference action. 
Jacob Smith had three touchdown runs for the Tigers, while Dylan Binion rushed for 153 yards for the Panthers (4-4, 2-3 ). 
Comets roll 
BELLEVUE — Bellevue scored three touchdowns in the third quarter on the way to a 35-0 victory against Durant-Bennett on Friday night. 
Cade Daugherty ran for one touchdown and threw for another, and the Comets also scored on a fumble recovery in the end zone by Riley Konrady. 
River Hawks fall 
DELHI — Maquoketa Valley handed Easton Valley its second loss in a row Friday, winning 49-24. 
Cardinals win 
MAQUOKETA — Maquoketa wrapped up district play with a win and guaranteed itself a first-round playoff home game with a 31-7 victory against rival Central DeWitt. 
Thunder fall 
GALENA, Ill. — Galena built a 20-0 lead in the first half and went on to defeat West Carroll 49-28 on Friday in Northwest Upstate Illini Conference football. 
Ethan Mangler rushed for 99 yards and two touchdowns to lead the Thunder, who slipped to 5-3 on the season.
